entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can activate your Channel Divinity to more easily remember facts. For the next hour you can add your Charisma modifier to all Intelligence based ability checks.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Inspiring Speech
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you shout a few inspiring words. Any number of creatures of your choice, to a maximum equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), that you can see within 30ft, gain the ability to reroll one {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, taking the highest result. The creature can use the reroll once in the next hour.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Freedom
entries: Starting at 7th level, you grant others the ability to travel unhindered. Whenever a creature starts their turns within 10 feet of you, they can move an additional 5 feet that turn. In addition to that you and all friendly creatures can't be {@condition Grappled|XPHB} or {@condition Restrained|XPHB} and aren't affected by {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} while they are in your aura. The aura is inactive while you are {@condition incapacitated|XPHB}.
At 18th level, this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Smooth Redirection
entries: Starting at 15th level, you can easily deflect any ranged attack. Whenever you or another creature, within 5 feet of you, is hit by a ranged attack, you use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to try to redirect the projectile/force. Your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} grants the target a bonus to AC equal to your charisma modifier (minimum of 1). If that makes the attack miss, you may make a ranged spell attack roll against one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. On a hit they suffer the original damage and potential effects.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), regaining all uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

activation.condition: Whenever you or another creature, within 5 feet of you, is hit by a ranged attack

subclassFeature.name: Emissary of the Wind
entries: At 20th level, you have become so well-travelled that you and your knowledge travel as fast as the wind. As an {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, you can activate the avatar of travel, which grants the following benefits for 1 hour:

items: Your base movement speed is 50ft.
You sprout wings and gain a flying speed equal to your base speed.
Any friendly creature within 5ft of you has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma based ability checks.

entries: Once you use this feature, it can't be used again until you have finished a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 5 spell slot (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Wave Guard
entries: Wave Guards are rangers who protect the seas from harm from humanoid activity. In return the seas grant them a connection to the water itself. Harnessing this connection, they become a destructive, yet also soothing, force of nature.

subclassFeature.name: Wave Guard
entries: Wave Guards are rangers who protect the seas from harm from humanoid activity. In return the seas grant them a connection to the water itself. Harnessing this connection, they become a destructive, yet also soothing, force of nature.

subclassFeature.name: Wave Guard Magic
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Wave Guard Spells table. The spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of ranger spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Wave Guard Magic
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Wave Guard Spells table. The spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of ranger spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Of the Seas
entries: Also at 3rd level, you have grown accustomed to life around the seas. Because of this you gain a swimming speed equal to your base speed. In addition to that you can also hold your breath for up to 10 minutes.

subclassFeature.name: Water Whip
entries: Also at 3rd level, your connection to the seas has allowed you to harness the water in the earth and skies. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} you can now summon a {@item Water Whip|WoBrCa}, which is a finesse melee weapon, with 10 foot reach, dealing {@damage 1d10} + your spellcasting ability modifier slashing damage.

In addition to that, once per turn when you hit with the whip, you can use it to heal yourself for an amount equal to half the weapon's damage. This does not work after hitting constructs or undead. You can use this healing feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) , regaining all uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
The whip stays summoned until you drop it, are {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}, or haven't attacked with it for 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Starting at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Healing Rivers
entries: Starting at 7th level, you know how a bit of fresh water can improve the repair of wounds. Whenever you or someone else uses an ability to heal a creature within 5 feet of you, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to increase the healing by an amount of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half your level (rounded down) + your wisdom modifier.
This does not affect constructs or undead.

subclassFeature.name: Rolling Waves
entries: Starting at 11th level, you know how to roll like the waves, which makes it easier for you to dodge attacks. Whenever you are hit by an attack you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to reduce the damage by {@dice 1d10} + your Dexterity modifier + half your Ranger level (rounded down). When this reduces the damage to 0, that attack's energy will be transported in your next weapon attack, giving you advantage on it.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) , regaining all uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Wave Rider
entries: Starting at 15th level, you can summon forth a wave you ride to your enemy. You can use your action to summon a 5-foot-high wave, which you can ride for up to 30 feet. Any creature caught in the wave, while you ride it, must succeed a Strength saving throw against your spellcasting DC or take {@damage 10d8} bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition Prone}, half as much on a successful one. Creatures one size larger than you have advantage on this saving throw.
You can use this feature once, regaining all uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Moonstrike
entries: Rogues who pick this archetype have always felt closer to the energy that is being provided by the celestial bodies. Due to this they can utilise it for their fighting style.

subclassFeature.name: Moonstrike
entries: Rogues who pick this archetype have always felt closer to the energy that is being provided by the celestial bodies. Due to this they can utilise it for their fighting style.

subclassFeature.name: Moon Phase
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you have become so attuned to the energy of the moon that you can change your own to reflect one of its phases. After you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can choose to enter one of the following phases:

items.name: New Moon
entries: While in the new moon phase, your energy is nothing but dark. While hiding in dim light or darkness, you have advantage on Dexterity (stealth) checks to hide.

items.name: Waxing Moon
entries: While in the waxing moon phase, you are filled with luck. After having rolled a saving throw, you can use your reaction to add {@dice 1d4} to the result of the roll, potentially turning a failure into a success.

items.name: Full Moon
entries: While in the full moon phase, your energy is so bright, that you gain an additional 60 feet of darkvision. In addition to that, rolling a Wisdom (perception) check in darkness doesn't impose disadvantage.

items.name: Waning Moon
entries: While in the waning moon phase, you have an easier time cutting down your foe. After you have rolled your attack roll, you can choose to use your reaction to add an 1d4 to that roll, potentially turning a miss into a hit.

subclassFeature.name: Solar Burst
entries: Also at 3rd level, you can harness the energy of the sun to blind your foes. Whenever you make an attack, you can imbue the strike with light of the sun. Hit or miss the creature must succeed a Constitution saving throw, with a DC of 8 + your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB proficiency bonus} + your wisdom modifier, or be blinded for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Cunning Strike: Solar Burst
entries: Also at 3rd level, you get an additional cunning strike option:

items.name: Solar Burst (Cost: 1d6)
entries: Your sneak attack becomes radiant damage. Additionally, the target must succeed a Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on Wisdom (perception) checks until the end of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Star Shower
entries: Starting at 9th level, you can let the stars rain. After you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can let stars rain down from the sky. The energy from it gives up to 10 creatures, of your choice, that you had rested with, {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 1d10} + your rogue level.
These temporary hitpoints last until they finish another rest.

subclassFeature.name: Star Shower
entries: Starting at 9th level, you can let the stars rain. After you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can let stars rain down from the sky. The energy from it gives up to 10 creatures, of your choice, that you had rested with, {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 1d10} + your rogue level.
These temporary hitpoints last until they finish another rest.

subclassFeature.name: Better Moon
entries: Starting at 13th level, you have become even more attuned to the energy of the moon, each phase offers an additional effect. Additionally, you may have the effects of two consecutively listed phases active, such as New and Waning. You cannot gain the benefits of both the New and Full Moon or Waxing and Waning Moon Phases at the same time.

items.name: New Moon
entries: Your weapon attacks deal necrotic damage. Also, when you don't deal sneak sneak attack damage, you deal critical damage when rolling a 19 and 20.

items.name: Waxing Moon
entries: Your attacks give you life. When you deal sneak attack damage to a creature, you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your proficiency bonus plus half your level (rounded down).

items.name: Full Moon
entries: Your weapon attacks deal radiant damage. Also, on an attack without sneak attack damage, you can add an extra {@dice 2d6} to that damage.

items.name: Waning Moon
entries: When you hit a creature and deal sneak attack damage, you may roll another attack, as part of the same attack action, against that creature.

subclassFeature.name: Solar Eclipse
entries: Starting at 17th level, you can let your inner sun be blocked by the moon. As an action, you form a 30-foot-sphere of magical darkness around you. You can see perfectly fine in the darkness created by this effect. It lasts for 1 minute or until you are {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}.

In addition to that, any other creature that starts its turn in the sphere, or enters it for the first time, must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, using the DC of the Solar Burst ability, or it takes {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage. Half as much on a success.
You can use this feature once, regaining all uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Solar Eclipse
entries: Starting at 17th level, you can let your inner sun be blocked by the moon. As an action, you form a 30-foot-radius sphere of magical darkness around you. You can see perfectly fine in the darkness created by this effect. It lasts for 1 minute or until you are {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}.

In addition to that, any other creature that starts its turn in the sphere, or enters it for the first time, must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, using the DC of the Cunning Strike ability, or it takes {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage. Half as much on a success.
You can use this feature once, regaining all uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Cure Disease and Poison
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} expend 1 {@subclassFeature Healer Points|Fighter|PHB|Medic|WoBrCa|3||Healer Point} to touch a creature, to reattempt one saving throw to overcome being {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} or Diseased.

optionalfeature.name: Dispel Magic
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} touch one creature that is affected by a magical effect, to attempt to remove one active spell effect. Expend 1 to 9 {@subclassFeature Healer Points|Fighter|PHB|Medic|WoBrCa|3}. When you do so, you can instantly dispel a spell of a level that equals to an amount of 1 + the spell's level. If you are unable to instantly dispel it, make a Wisdom {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB}. The DC equals 12 + the spell's level.

optionalfeature.name: First Aid
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} expend 1 {@subclassFeature Healer Points|Fighter|PHB|Medic|WoBrCa|3||Healer Point} to quickly grab and use herbs or medicine to double your own speed until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Potions
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} expend 1 {@subclassFeature Healer Points|Fighter|PHB|Medic|WoBrCa|3||Healer Point} to administer one potion of healing (of any rarity), that you own. Instead of d4s use d6s for this potion.

optionalfeature.name: Invigorating Salts
entries: As a bonus action expend 1 to 5 {@subclassFeature Healer Points|Fighter|PHB|Medic|WoBrCa|3} to touch a creature to give them {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 1d10} + your Wisdom modifier. For each healer point after the 1st, the {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} gained increases by {@dice 1d10}.

optionalfeature.name: Patch Up Attachment
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} attach another Patch Up, you know, to a piece of ammunition, melee or thrown weapon. You {@subclassFeature Healer Points|Fighter|PHB|Medic|WoBrCa|3} points equal to 1 + the cost of the other patch up. When a creature hits another creature with a weapon or ammunition with an attachment, they take no damage but gain the effect of the Patch Up instead.
Ammunition and weapons lose the effect of this attachment after being used or at the end of a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Restore Health
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} expend 1 to 9 {@subclassFeature Healer Points|Fighter|PHB|Medic|WoBrCa|3} to touch a creature that is not dying, to restore {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 2d8} + your Wisdom modifier. For each {@subclassFeature Healer Points|Fighter|PHB|Medic|WoBrCa|3||Healer Point} after the 1st, the healing increases by {@dice 1d8}.

optionalfeature.name: Restore Life
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} expend one to 9 {@subclassFeature Healer Points|Fighter|PHB|Medic|WoBrCa|3} to touch a dying creature , to restore {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 2d6} + your Wisdom modifier. For each {@subclassFeature Healer Points|Fighter|PHB|Medic|WoBrCa|3||Healer Point} after the 1st, the healing increases by {@dice 1d6}.

optionalfeature.name: Restore Lifeforce
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} expend 2 {@subclassFeature Healer Points|Fighter|PHB|Medic|WoBrCa|3} to touch a creature to undo a maximum {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} reduction, equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Wisdom modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Restore Composure
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} expend 1 {@subclassFeature Healer Points|Fighter|PHB|Medic|WoBrCa|3||Healer Point} to touch a creature to have them reattempt one saving throw to overcome being {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, {@condition Frightened}, Mind Controlled, or {@variantrule Possession|XPHB|Possessed}.

optionalfeature.name: Restore Movement
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} expend 1 {@subclassFeature Healer Points|Fighter|PHB|Medic|WoBrCa|3||Healer Point} to touch a creature to have them reattempt one saving throw to overcome being {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, Slowed, or {@condition Stunned|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Restore Vision and Hearing
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} expend 1 {@subclassFeature Healer Points|Fighter|PHB|Medic|WoBrCa|3||Healer Point} to touch one creature to have them reattempt one saving throw to overcome being {@condition Blinded|XPHB} or {@condition Deafened|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Strengthen Attack
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} expend 3 {@subclassFeature Healer Points|Fighter|PHB|Medic|WoBrCa|3} to touch one creature to give them advantage on either weapon or spell attacks, of your choice, until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Strengthen Body
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} expend 2 {@subclassFeature Healer Points|Fighter|PHB|Medic|WoBrCa|3} to touch one creature to give them advantage on ability checks and saving throws using one of Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution, of your choice, until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Strengthen Will
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} expend 2 {@subclassFeature Healer Points|Fighter|PHB|Medic|WoBrCa|3} to touch one creature to give them advantage on ability checks and saving throws using one of Charisma, Intelligence, or Wisdom, of your choice, until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Wake Me Up
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} expend 1 {@subclassFeature Healer Points|Fighter|PHB|Medic|WoBrCa|3||Healer Point} wake a creature, you can touch, that has fallen {@condition Unconscious|XPHB}. Additionally, that creature may use their reaction to stand up and make an attack roll.

spell.name: Acid Rain
entries: You summon a 20-foot radius 5-foot thick cloud 90 feet above the ground. Any creature that enters the area below it for the first time, or starts its turn there must succeed a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 5d8} Acid damage, as acid rains down on them. Half damage on a success.
In addition to that, any creature underneath the cloud has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The extra damage increases by {@scaledamage 5d8|2-9|1d8} for each level after 5th.

spell.name: Ash Fall
entries: When initiative is rolled, you can let ash fall from the sky. All creatures of your choice, within 30 feet, must succeed a Constitution saving throw or take a {@dice 1d6} penalty to their initiative roll, as they suddenly breathe in the ash.

spell.name: Boil Fluids
entries: You increase the temperature of a water-like fluid until it starts boiling. If you target a creature, they must succeed a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} Fire damage and have disadvantage on their next attack roll, before the start of your next turn, as their body fluids start boiling. This spell has no effect on constructs or other creatures without body fluids.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@damage 1d6} when you reach levels 5 ({@damage 2d6}), 11 ({@damage 3d6}), and 17 ({@damage 4d6)}

spell.name: Celestial Telegraphing
entries: You utter five emotion filled words that you can send to up to 5 creatures with which you are familiar. These words must consist of a location (a location name counts as one word) and the reason for the emotion, such as danger, pain, or freedom. The final three words may be used for whatever you please.
Any creature with an intelligence score of 1 or higher can understand the meaning of the message.
You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence, but if the target is on a different plane than you, there is a 5 percent chance that the message doesn't arrive.

spell.name: Conveying Earth
entries: You touch natural earth that is at least 1-cubic foot in volume and turn it into a window into another part of the universe. As you stare into the earth, utter the name or description of a creature with which you are familiar. This will create a connection with the closest natural earth to that creature. The creature, provided it has at least an intelligence score of 1 and is within 120-feet of the piece of natural earth, will hear your voice. During the 1 minute duration you and the creature can converse like normal.

You can create a window between two spaces across any distance and even to other planes of existence, but if the target is on a different plane than you, there is a 5 percent chance that the connection can't be established.

spell.name: Conveying Fire
entries: You touch non-magical fire that is at least 1-cubic foot in volume and turn it into a window into another part of the universe. As you stare into the fire, utter the name or description of a creature with which you are familiar. This will create a connection with the closest non-magical fire to that creature. The creature, provided it has at least an intelligence score of 1 and is within 120-feet of the fire, will hear your voice. During the 1 minute duration you and the creature can converse like normal.

You can create a window between two spaces across any distance and even to other planes of existence, but if the target is on a different plane than you, there is a 5 percent chance that the connection can't be established.

spell.name: Conveying Water
entries: You touch natural water that is at least 1-cubic foot in volume and turn it into a window into another part of the universe. As you stare into the water, utter the name or description of a creature with which you are familiar. This will create a connection with the closest natural water source to that creature. The creature, provided it has at least an intelligence score of 1 and is within 120-feet of the source of natural water, will hear your voice. During the 1 minute duration you and the creature can converse like normal.

You can create a window between two spaces across any distance and even to other planes of existence, but if the target is on a different plane than you, there is a 5 percent chance that the connection can't be established.

spell.name: Dust Barrier
entries: You summon forth a cloud of dust that surrounds you, until the start of your next turn. Creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against you.
When a creature attacks you with a melee attack, within 5 feet, they must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d4} Slashing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@damage 1d4} when you reach levels 5 ({@damage 2d4}), 11 ({@damage 3d4}), and 17 ({@damage 4d4)}

spell.name: Earth Shaker
entries: You shake the ground directly around you. Each creature standing on the ground, within range, other than you, must succeed a Strength saving throw or take {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition Prone|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@damage 1d4} when you reach levels 5 ({@damage 2d4}), 11 ({@damage 3d4}), and 17 ({@damage 4d4)}

spell.name: Elemental Messenger

m.text: A piece of paper and magical ink worth 5+ GP.

entries: You summon forth a small elemental, taking a shape of your choice, and hand it a written  message, of 100 words or less. When you do so, utter a name or description of a creature with which you are familiar. The elemental messenger will try to deliver it to the creature. It will take the messenger at least 12 hours to locate the creature and deliver the message. Once the message has been delivered the creature can respond in a like manner immediately, but may choose to delay it. Either way it'll take at least 12 hours for a reply to arrive at the caster. The spell enables a creature with at least an intelligence score of 1 to understand the meaning of your message.
You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence, but if the target is on a different plane than you, there is a 5 percent chance that the message doesn't arrive.

spell.name: Ember Spray
entries: You send out a 15-foot cone of tiny hot embers. Each creature in that area must succeed a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d10} Fire damage and become {@condition Blinded|XPHB} until the end of their next turn. Only half as much damage on a success.
Flammable objects in the area, which are not worn or carried, will be ignited by this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The extra damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d10|2-9|1d10} for each level after 2nd

spell.name: False Note
entries: You play or sing a note that is so incorrect that hurts one creature within 30 feet. That creature must succeed a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} psychic damage and must subtract {@dice 1d4} from the next attack roll or ability check they make, before the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@damage 1d6} when you reach levels 5 ({@damage 2d6}), 11 ({@damage 3d6}), and 17 ({@damage 4d6)}

spell.name: Fear Feed
entries: You can temporarily feel stronger when a creature becomes sad or frightened. When a creature you can see within 30 feet, has been successfully Intimidated, using a Charisma (Intimidation) check or has gained the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level or 3, depending on which one is higher.

spell.name: Heal Minor Wounds

components.m: A piece of cloth and a drop of alcohol

entries: You touch a creature and make minor wounds and scars disappear. The creature regains {@damage 1d4} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, and up to two of its minor wounds disappear.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the amount of wounds that can be cured increases by 1 for each spell slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Hurl Magma
entries: You summon forth magma in your hands which you then hurl up to 60 feet. Make a ranged spell attack, on a hit the target takes {@damage 2d6} Fire and {@damage 1d6} Bludgeoning damage. As the magma cools and crystallises it will reduce the target's speed by 5 feet, until they use an action to remove it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The Fire damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d6|1-9|1d6} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Locate Location

components.m: A bit of stone dust and vines

entries: Describe a location that is familiar to you, through either tales or because you have been there before. You can know the direction of that location, as long as it is within 50 miles from where you are. If the location looks different from what you had described, it will tell you.
This spell can locate a specific location, or the nearest one of its kind, like a tavern, a town. If the location is hidden from divination magic, it can't be located using this spell.

spell.name: Magma Skin
entries: Your skin becomes actual magma, which is scorching to the touch. Any creature that touches you or hits you with a melee attack within 5 feet, will take {@damage 1d6} Fire damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The extra  damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d10|2-9|1d6} for each level above 2nd.

spell.name: Mend Flesh and Bones

m.text: Silver Dust worth 100+ GP, which the spell consumes

entries: You throw the silver dust in the air and it flows towards the injured creature of your choice within range. One injury that can be healed by this spell is healed for that creature. And it regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to  {@dice 1d12} + your spellcasting modifiers.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target an additional creature and/or wound per spell level above 5th.

spell.name: Mind Mend

m.text: A small hand drill, and poppy seeds worth 50+ gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a willing creature on their forehead while saying soothing words to them. As a consequence they take {@damage 2} points of psychic damage and regain {@dice 2} points of the Sanity score, but never higher than 10. This spell can also instantly cure the {@condition Frightened} condition, a {@variantrule Sanity|WobrCa|Bout of Madness}, and {@variantrule Sanity|WoBrCa|Long Term Madness} effect.

spell.name: Minute Shift
entries: When you see a creature fail or succeed a saving throw or attack roll, you may add or subtract {@dice 1d4} to their result (your choice). An unwilling creature can attempt a Wisdom saving throw to resist this effect.

spell.name: Orb of Chaos
entries: You summon a giant orb in an unoccupied place you can see within 1 mile. When cast and at the start of each of your turns, any creature, except the caster, within 90 feet of the orb, must succeed a Dexterity saving throw or be bathed in a light radiating from the orb. Roll a {@dice 1d8} to see what light a creature is bathed in.

entries.caption: Orb of Chaos
rows: {@b Red.} A red light that burns anyone and deals {@damage 6d6} Fire damage and puts the target on fire, dealing {@damage 3d6} Fire damage at the start of each of their turns, or only half as much damage on a success. A creature can use an action to douse themselves
{@b Blue.} A blue light holds a creature stuck in place until the end of your next turn, the creature is {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}.

{@b Yellow.} A yellow light crackles with energy and deals {@damage 6d6} Radiant damage and the target is {@condition Blinded} until the start of your next turn, or only half as much damage on a success.

{@b green.} A green light melts your skin off and deals {@damage 6d6} Acid damage and an additional {@damage 6d4} acid damage at the start of each of the creature's turns, or only half as much damage on a success. The creature can use an action to remove the acid.
{@b Orange.} An orange light confuses the target, like it is affected by the {@spell Confusion|XPHB} spell, until the end of its next turn.
{@b Purple.} A purple light {@condition Charmed|XPHB|Charms} anyone within it until the end of your next turn. The creature must obey your next one word command.
{@b Black.} A black light takes away your energy and deals {@damage 8d10} Necrotic damage, or half as much on a success.
{@b Multiple.} The creature is affected by two Light effects, roll two d8s. If you roll an 8 or the same number twice, reroll that die.

spell.name: Spectral Form
entries: You temporarily turn a willing creature partially spectral. That creature can move through other creature's spaces without issue. Other creatures can move through its space as if it is difficult terrain. When one creature ends its turn in the space of another, they take {@damage 1d10} force damage and are moved back to the last unoccupied space they were in.

spell.name: Sticky Hold
entries: You create a sticky surface in an unoccupied area no larger than 5 by 5 feet, within range. This surface is strong enough to keep up to 500 pounds attached. A creature that enters the sticky surface area for the first time or attempts to remove an object from the sticky surface, must succeed a Strength (athletics) ability check against your spell save DC, or be {@condition Grappled|XPHB}. They can repeat the check at the start of each of their turns.
Once you create a new sticky surface the previous one disappears.

spell.name: Wave of Protection
entries: When a creature you see is hit by an attack roll from a hostile creature, you can use your reaction to summon forth a wave of protective water. That creature gains {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your level or 3, depending on which one is higher.

spell.name: Wind Burst
entries: You give the creature you touch the speed of the wind. On their next turn or, if the target is yourself, your current turn, the creature can move an additional 5 feet on top of their normal movement. If they hit with a weapon attack, after moving at least 5 feet to their target, that target takes an additional {@damage 1d4} slashing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@damage 1d4} when you reach levels 5 ({@damage 2d4}), 11 ({@damage 3d4}), and 17 ({@damage 4d4)}

entries.name: Concealable
entries: A concealable weapon grants you advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) checks to try to hide it (on your person).

entries.name: Loud
entries: A weapon with the loud property creates the sound of a thunderous boom when used, which can be heard up to 300 feet away.

entries.name: Loud
entries: A weapon with the loud property creates the sound of a thunderous boom when used, which can be heard up to 300 feet away.

entries.name: Loud
entries: A weapon with the loud property creates the sound of a thunderous boom when used, which can be heard up to 300 feet away.

entries.name: Burst Fire
entries: A weapon with the burst fire property can be used for normal shots, but also as an Area of Effect shot. When you use it as an AoE shot, all creatures in a 10 feet cone in front of you must succeed a Dexterity saving throw or take the weapon's normal damage. Half as much on a success. The DC for this attack is equal to: 8 + your proficiency (if proficient) + your Dexterity modifier.
The burst fire shot uses 2 pieces of ammunition for each creature in the AoE.

entries.name: Loud
entries: A weapon with the loud property creates the sound of a thunderous boom when used, which can be heard up to 300 feet away.

entries.name: Loud
entries: A weapon with the loud property creates the sound of a thunderous boom when used, which can be heard up to 300 feet away.

entries.name: Elemental
entries: An elemental has been made with charged crystals, which change the damage type. When you pick this weapon, choose an elemental damage type, which it'll deal instead: Acid ({@item Corroding Revolver|WoBrCa}), Cold ({@item Freezing Revolver|WoBrCa}), Fire ({@item Burning Revolver|WoBrCa}), Lightning ({@item Arcing Revolver|WoBrCa}), Thunder ({@item Booming Revolver|WoBrCa}).

entries.name: Loud
entries: A weapon with the loud property creates the sound of a thunderous boom when used, which can be heard up to 300 feet away.

item.name: Dynamite Stick
entries: An an {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, you can light a Dynamite Stick and throw it at a point up to 60 feet away, where it explodes. Additionally, you can connect it with a fuse you ignite from a safe distance. A black powder fuse will have a burn rate of 10ft/round. A dynamite plunger will ignite it instantly, no matter the distance.

Each creature in a 5-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point must succeed a DC 8 + {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} + Dexterity Modifier (if thrown) or DC 8 + {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} + Intelligence/Wisdom Mod (if ignited with a fuse) Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d6} Force damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

It takes 1 minute to bind two or more Dynamite Sticks together so they explode at the same time. Each stick after the first increases the damage by {@damage 1d6} (to a maximum of {@damage 10d6}) and the effect's radius by 5 feet (to a maximum of 20 feet). It takes 1 minute to rig dynamite with a longer fuse so it explodes after a longer period of time, such as 1 minute or 10 minutes.

item.name: Smoke Bomb
entries: As an action, you can either throw a grenade at a point up to 60 feet away . The bomb explodes at that point, creating a particular effect in a 20-foot-radius sphere.
The area of the sphere] is {@variantrule Heavily Obscured|XPHB} by smoke for 1 minute. A strong wind (such as the {@spell Gust of Wind|XPHB} spell) disperses the smoke.

item.name: Black Powder (Pouch)
entries: This amount of black powder can be spread out in a 10 feet long 1 inch line.

Once you have 12gp worth of black powder it can be used as an damaging explosive, dealing 1d6 fire damage to the 5ft square it is detonated in, provided it is in a closed container. At 24gp, it will deal {@damage 2d6} fire damage at a 5 foot radius emanation. At 36gp, it will deal {@damage 3d6} fire damage at a 10 foot radius emanation. A creature caught in the blast must succeed a DC 8 + {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} + Dexterity Modifier (if thrown) or DC 8 + {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} + Intelligence/Wisdom Mod (if ignited with a fuse) Dexterity saving throw. On a success they take half damage. The black powder container can be thrown up to 60 feet.

item.name: Water Whip
entries: A weapon summoned by a {@class Ranger|XPHB|Wave Guard Ranger|Wave|WoBrCa}.

feat.name: Tail Rejuvination
entries: Due to the magic stored inside your tails you may regain some spent spell slots. Once per {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you may spend 1 minute to regain spell slots with a combined level that equal to or less than half your tail amount (rounded up).

variantrule.name: Sanity
entries: The sanity score represents how well your character can deal with situations that cannot be properly explained by the sane mind. Getting exposed to such a situation can both make you more accustomed to it or drive you insane.
The DM may ask you to use your Sanity ability for {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB|Skill Checks}, instead of Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma, for these types of checks:

items: Checks to decipher alien texts, remembering stuff about unfathomable creatures that were mentioned between the lines of books you read, or making an accurate assessment about the creature's nature.
Perceiving a thing about, trying to befriend an unfathomable creature, or trying to determine such a creature's intentions.
Acting normally when facing an unfathomable creature or when already driven insane.

entries: The Sanity {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} will be rolled once a character tries to resist an effect that may potentially drive them mad. Such rolls may be asked in these situations:

items: When meeting an unfathomable creature for the first time.
When trying to resist an effect that directly affects your mental stability.
Passing through a realm created by an unfathomable creature or a humanoid under its control.

entries: Whenever you fail a Sanity saving throw by five or more, you'll be affected by a temporary bout of madness (listed later in this section.)

entries.name: Increasing and Decreasing Sanity
entries: A person dealing with the Occult will not remain as sane as the average individual forever. Every now and again their sanity score will change, which will impact how they behave themselves.
The Sanity Score of a character will only increase in the following ways:

items: Dealing with an unfathomable creature or getting through its realm without losing any Sanity. Usually you'll be awarded 2 Sanity for this.
Using a spell to restore sanity, such as {@spell Mind Mend|WoBrCa}.
Spending a week per Sanity recovering, preventing you from doing any other downtime activities. Your Sanity can never increase above 10 through this method.

entries: Your Sanity is never able to exceed 20, unless another source of Sanity specifically states it bypasses this rule.
The Sanity Score of a character may decrease due to the following reasons:

items: Failing a Sanity {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB}. Usually this only reduces your Sanity score by 1.
Failing a Sanity {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB} by five or more, which will only reduce your Sanity score by 1.
Using an Occult item, which will award you power in return for a bit of your sanity.

entries: When your Sanity score is reduced to 0, your character is mechanically dead. They may instantly die of a heart attack or be driven so insane that they are unplayable. Reviving the character that died of a heart attack follows the normal rules, and will leave them with 1 Sanity when they come back. The other one can be brought back using a sanity restoring spell, such as mind mend.

entries.name: Tiers of Sanity
entries: Your Sanity score doesn't just apply a bonus or penalty to saving throws, it will also have some other effects on you, as shown in the table below.

entries.name: Bout of Madness
entries: Whenever you fail a Sanity saving throw badly, you may temporarily go insane. When this happens, roll on the following table, to apply a form of insanity your character will adhere to for {@dice 1d10} minutes. Another creature can attempt to snap you out of your madness early, by using their action by making a Wisdom (Medicine) check (DC 15). On a success the creature is no longer affected by the Bout of Madness. On a failure that creature cannot attempt it again.

entries.name: Long Term and Indefinite Madness
entries: Whenever you become too insane you might need more than a Bout of Madness. Instead you'd get a Long Term or Indefinite Madness effect. A Long Term Madness effect is supposed to last between a day or a few weeks, while Indefinite Madness may be permanent, such as getting a new Phobia. There are no immediate cures for Long Term and Indefinite Madness.
In the table below you can see examples of Long Term Madness effects. You can roll a {@dice 1d100} to randomly decide which should apply.

variantrule.name: Injuries
entries: Whenever you are reduced to 0 hit points or take damage equal to at least half your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Maximum from a single effect, you have a chance of obtaining an injury. Make a Constitution or Intelligence (if psychic damage) {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} against a DC equal to 10 + half your level (round down). On a failure roll on the injury table from the {@variantrule Damage Types|XPHB|Damage Type} that dealt the most damage, to determine your injury.

entries.name: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Radiant Injury

variantrule.name: Fate Dice
entries: At the start of each session, fate coins will be distributed in the following way:
Each person rolls a straight d20, on a 1 to 9 the coin is added to the DM's pile. On a 10-20, the dice is added to the player's pile. When a coin is used, it will be moved to the other pile.
The players can use their coin in the following ways:

items: Players can add {@dice 1d6} to any {@variantrule D20 Test}. This dice can only be added before the roll is made.

Players can spend a coin to alter the effect of a spell or feature in a way it was not originally intended. After the player explains what they would like to do, the DM can say if it is possible and what alternatives are, if not. Additionally, the DM can say that it'll require more coins. Often this takes the form of a devil's bargain.

Players can spend a coin to take an {@variantrule Action|XPHB} that would fit in a narrative way for the character, but which wouldn't normally be possible according to the rules. For example, a character who is reduced to 0 hp may spend a coin to use their {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make one last {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB} or run away up to their speed, while they are struck down.

entries: The DM can use their coin in the following ways:

items: The DM adds {@dice 1d6} to any {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB} made by a creature. This dice must be added before the roll is made.
The DM spends a coin to change a situation to be more interesting. Usually this shows itself in the form of an additional complication, but it can also be used for a beneficial effect.
A powerful creature under the DM's control can have abilities that it can only use by spending a Fate Coin.

table.name: Tiers of Sanity
rows: Mechanical Death (completely insane or heart attack).

A long term or indefinite madness effect that seems fitting (Discuss it with your DM to make it fun for you as a player to deal with). This effect may last even after your score is restored above it, but only if the player wants it.
Extra failure condition of Sanity checks and saving throws becomes failing by 7 or more instead of 5.
Extra failure condition of Sanity checks and saving throws becomes failing by 10 or more instead of 5.

table.name: Bout of Madness
rows: {@b Cower.} Whenever you fail a Sanity saving throw badly, you may temporarily go insane. When this happens, roll on the following table, to apply a form of insanity your character will temporarily adhere to. Another creature can attempt to snap you out of your madness, by using their action by making a Wisdom (Medicine) check (DC 15). On a success the creature is no longer affected by the Bout of Madness. On a failure that creature cannot attempt it again.
{@b Freeze.} The character is unable to move from their spot by themselves. They can still take actions, if the player wants them to, provided they do not make the character move.

{@b Impulsive.} The character is unable to think strategically and acts impulsively, which may lead to situations where they, for example, use all their powerful abilities when they normally would conserve them. The player can choose in what way the character is negatively impacted by acting impulsively.
{b Aggression.} The character becomes very aggressive. This may out itself in attacking the closest creature, destroying objects, or any other way the player deems fitting.

{@b Hesitation.} The character is unsure of what to do in the current situation. Whenever the character wants to use their action for something, they must succeed on an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw (DC 10), their choice. On a failure they must take any other action of their choice.

{@b Faint.} The character falls unconscious, until you take damage or someone uses their action to shake you awake. At the end of their turns, after awakening, your character must make an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw (DC 15), their choice, as long as their source of madness is within sight. On a failure, they fall unconscious again.

table.name: Long Term Madness
rows: {@b Hide Away.} Your character may prefer not to move from a certain spot, believing they will get harmed if they do.
{@b Move On.} The character does not want to stop, believing that stopping will allow the danger to catch up.
{@b Hostility.} The character becomes hostile towards everyone. This might out itself as snapping at your allies or attacking anyone who gets too close.
{@b Drowsy.} The character thinks they can only escape the bad things in their dreams. They will seek to sleep as much as possible.
{@b Indecision.} The character cannot decide on the right course of action, believing danger could lurk behind either of the options.
{@b Hallucinations} The character sees the world in a different way to the rest. For example, they might think an enemy looks like a cute puppy.

table.name: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Radiant Injury
rows: {@b Popped Eye.} You have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight and ranged {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|Attack Rolls}. This can be restored with the {@spell Regenerate|XPHB} spell.

{@b Burned Hand.} Each time you hold an item with that hand you must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or drop the item. All {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB|Ability Checks} and {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|Attack Rolls} made with that hand have disadvantage. This can be healed with the {@spell Mend Flesh and Bones|WoBrCa} spell. After 2 weeks it becomes a Major Burn.

{@b Burned Foot.} Your movement speed is halved, and you have disadvantage on Strength {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB|Ability Checks} if you have to use your foot for it. After ending your movement when you {@action Dash|XPHB} you fall {@condition Prone|XPHB}. This can be healed with the {@spell Mend Flesh and Bones|WoBrCa} spell. After 2 weeks it becomes a Major Burn.

{@b Burned Leg.} Your movement speed is reduced by 5ft and you have disadvantage on {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB|Ability Checks} if you use your leg for it. You must make a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw after ending your movement when you take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action This can be healed with the {@spell Mend Flesh and Bones|WoBrCa} spell. After 2 weeks it becomes a Major Burn.

{@b Burned Arm.}  You have disadvantage on {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB|Ability Checks} and {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|Attack Rolls} you make using this arm. This can be healed with the {@spell Mend Flesh and Bones|WoBrCa} spell. After 2 weeks it becomes a Major Burn.

{@b Major Burn.} You get burned in a place very visible to others. You have disadvantage on Charisma (Persuasion) and advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks. This can be removed with the {@spell Heal Minor Wounds|WoBrCa} spell.
{@b Minor Burn.} The burn doesn't have any adverse effect. This can be removed with the {@spell Heal Minor Wounds|WoBrCa} spell.

table.name: Bludgeoning, Force, or Thunder Injury
rows: {@b Destroyed Eye.} You have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight and ranged {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|Attack Rolls}. This can be restored with the {@spell Regenerate|XPHB} spell.

{@b Broken Arm or Hand.} You can no longer hold anything with two hands, and you can hold only a single object at a time. All {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB|Ability Checks} and {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|Attack Rolls} made with it have disadvantage. This can be healed with the {@spell Mend Flesh and Bones|WoBrCa} spell. After 2 weeks it becomes a Major Bruise.

{@b Broken Foot or Leg.} Your speed on foot is halved, and you must use a cane or crutch to move. You fall {@condition Prone|XPHB} after ending your movement when using the {@action Dash|XPHB} action. All {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB|Ability Checks} and {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|Attack Rolls} made with it have disadvantage. This can be healed with the {@spell Mend Flesh and Bones|WoBrCa} spell. After 2 weeks it becomes a Major Bruise.

{@b Internal Injury.} You have to move much more carefully when you take your actions. If you take both an action and bonus action on your turn or take a reaction, you lose {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your level. This reduction cannot be reduced. The internal injury can be healed with the {@spell Mend Flesh and Bones|WoBrCa} spell. After 2 weeks the Internal Injury will naturally heal.
{@b Broken Rib.} This has the same effect as the Internal Injury, but the damage you take is equal to half your level (round up).

{@b Limp.} Your speed on foot is reduced by 5 feet. All {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB|Ability Checks} and {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|Attack Rolls} made with the foot have disadvantage. You must make a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw after ending your movement when you take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action. If you fail the save, you fall {@condition Prone|XPHB}. This can be healed with the {@spell Heal Minor Wounds|WoBrCa} spell.

{@b Major Bruise.} You get a bad bruise in a place very visible to others. You have disadvantage on Charisma (Persuasion) and advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks. This can be removed with the {@spell Heal Minor Wounds|WoBrCa} spell. After 1 week the Major Bruise will naturally heal.
{@b Bruises.} The bruise doesn't have any adverse effect. This can be removed with the {@spell Heal Minor Wounds|WoBrCa} spell. After 1 week the Bruise will naturally heal.

table.name: Necrotic Injury
rows: {@b Withered Eye.} You have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight and ranged {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|Attack Rolls}. This can be restored with the {@spell Regenerate|XPHB} spell.

{@b Withering Wound.}  Your hit point maximum is reduced by 2 every 24 hours the wound persists. If your hit point maximum drops to 0, you die. The wound heals with the {@spell Heal Minor Wounds|WoBrCa} spell. Alternatively, someone can tend to the wound and make a DC 15 Wisdom (Medicine) check once every 24 hours, preventing the loss of maximum {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. After ten successes, the wound heals.

{@b Withered Hand.} Each time you hold an item with that hand you must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or drop the item. All {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB|Ability Checks} and {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|Attack Rolls} made with that hand have disadvantage. This can be healed with the {@spell Mend Flesh and Bones|WoBrCa} spell. After 2 weeks it becomes a Major Wither Spot.

{@b Withered Foot.} Your movement speed is halved, and you have disadvantage on Strength {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB|Ability Checks} if you have to use your foot for it. After ending your movement when you {@action Dash|XPHB}, you fall {@condition Prone|XPHB}. This can be healed with the {@spell Mend Flesh and Bones|WoBrCa} spell. After 2 weeks it becomes a Major Wither Spot.

{@b Withered Arm.} You have disadvantage on {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB|Ability Checks} and {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|Attack Rolls} you make using this arm. This can be healed by the {@spell Mend Flesh and Bones|WoBrCa} spell. After 2 weeks it becomes a Major Wither spot.

{@b Withered Leg.} Your speed on foot is reduced by 5 feet. All {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB|Ability Checks} and {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|Attack Rolls} made with the foot have disadvantage. You must make a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw after ending your movement when you take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action. If you fail the save, you fall {@condition Prone|XPHB}. This can be healed with the {@spell Heal Minor Wounds|WoBrCa} spell. After 2 weeks it becomes a Major Wither Spot.

{@b Major Wither Spot.} You get a huge wither spot in place very visible for others. You have disadvantage on Charisma (Persuasion) and advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks. This can be removed with the {@spell Heal Minor Wounds|WoBrCa} spell.
{@b Minor Wither Spot.} The wither spot doesn't have any adverse effect.

table.name: Piercing Injury
rows: {@b Lose an Eye.} You have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight and ranged {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|Attack Rolls}. This can be restored with the {@spell Regenerate|XPHB} spell.

{@b Blood Loss.} You lose maximum {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your level at the end of your turns. Casting {@spell Heal Minor Wounds|WoBrCa} or making a DC 15 Wisdom (medicine) check, using a charge of the healer's kit, will stop the blood loss. Making a DC 15 Wisdom (medicine) check, without the use of a healer's kit will stop the bleeding for an hour.

{@b Broken Arm or Hand.} You can no longer hold anything with two hands, and you can hold only a single object at a time. All {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB|Ability Checks} and {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|Attack Rolls} made with it have disadvantage. This can be healed with the {@spell Mend Flesh and Bones|WoBrCa} spell. After 2 weeks it becomes a Major Cut scar.

{@b Broken Foot or Leg.} Your speed on foot is halved, and you must use a cane or crutch to move. You fall {@condition Prone|XPHB} after ending your movement when using the {@action Dash|XPHB} action. All {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB|Ability Checks} and {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|Attack Rolls} made with it have disadvantage. This can be healed with the {@spell Mend Flesh and Bones|WoBrCa} spell. After 2 weeks it becomes a Major Cut scar.

{@b Internal Injury.} You have to move much more carefully when you take your actions. If you take both an action and bonus action on your turn or take a reaction, you lose {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your level. This health loss cannot be reduced. The internal injury can be healed with the {@spell Mend Flesh and Bones|WoBrCa} spell. After 2 weeks the Internal Injury will naturally heal.
{@b Broken Rib.} This has the same effect as the Internal Injury, but the damage you take is equal to half your level (round up).

{@b Limp.} Your speed on foot is reduced by 5 feet. All {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB|Ability Checks} and {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|Attack Rolls} made with the foot have disadvantage. You must make a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw after ending your movement when you take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action. If you fail the save, you fall {@condition Prone|XPHB}. This can be healed with the {@spell Heal Minor Wounds|WoBrCa} spell.

{@b Major Cuts.} You get a bad cut in a place very visible to others. You have disadvantage on Charisma (Persuasion) and advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks. This can be removed with the {@spell Heal Minor Wounds|WoBrCa} spell. After 1 week the Major Cuts will naturally heal and turn into a scar, which has no adverse effects.
{@b Cuts.} The cuts don't have any adverse effect. This can be removed with the {@spell Heal Minor Wounds|WoBrCa} spell. After 1 week the cuts will naturally heal.

table.name: Poison Injury
rows: {@b Poisoned Muscles.} You get disadvantage on all {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB|Ability Checks}, {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|Saving Throws}, and {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|Attack Rolls}. This can be healed with the {@spell Mend Flesh and Bones|WoBrCa} spell. After 2 weeks it becomes Major Poison Bumps.

{@b Poisoned Heart.} Your hit point maximum decreases by an amount equal to your level at the end of every day. If your hitpoint maximum drops to 0 you are {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} but stable. This can be healed with the {@spell Mend Flesh and Bones|WoBrCa} spell or by making a DC 15 Wisdom (medicine) check using a charge of a healer's kit at the end of a Long Rest. Once it is healed you regain all your lost {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

Poisoned Lungs. When you use verbal components to cast a spell or speak during combat, you lose {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half your level (round up). This can be healed with the {@spell Mend Flesh and Bones|WoBrCa} spell. After 2 weeks it heals naturally.
{@b Poisoned Brain.} You get disadvantage on all Wisdom and Intelligence checks and saves. This can be healed with the {@spell Mend Flesh and Bones|WoBrCa} spell. After 2 weeks it heals naturally.
{@b Poisoned Wound.} You become {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} for 1 hour. After that hour you get Poison Bumps.

{@b Major Poison Bumps.} You get many poison bumps in a place very visible for others. You have disadvantage on Charisma (Persuasion) and advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks. This can be removed with the {@spell Heal Minor Wounds|WoBrCa} spell.
{@b Minor Poison Bumps.} The poison bumps don't have any adverse effect. This can be removed with the {@spell Heal Minor Wounds|WoBrCa} spell.

table.name: Psychic Injury
rows: {@b Mental Break.} Roll on the {@table Long Term Madness|WoBrCa} table, you gain that madness effect until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
{@b Bout of Madness.} Roll on the {@table Bout of Madness|WoBrCa} table. You gain that bout for {@dice 1d10} minutes.
{@b Confusion.} You are under the effects of the {@spell Confusion|XPHB} spell for 1 minute.
{@b Mental Agony.} You take additional psychic damage equal to your level.
{@b Mental Pain.} You take additional psychic damage equal to half your level (round up).

table.name: Slashing Injury
rows: {@b Lose an Eye.} You have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight and ranged {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|Attack Rolls}. This can be restored with the {@spell Regenerate|XPHB} spell.

The internal injury can be healed with the {@spell Mend Flesh and Bones|WoBrCa} spell. After 2 weeks the Internal Injury will naturally heal.
{@b Broken Rib.} This has the same effect as the Internal Injury, but the damage you take is equal to half your level (round up).

{@b Limp.} Your speed on foot is reduced by 5 feet. All {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB|Ability Checks} and {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|Attack Rolls} made with the foot have disadvantage. You must make a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw after ending your movement when you take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action. If you fail the save, you fall {@condition Prone|XPHB}. This can be healed with the {@spell Heal Minor Wounds|WoBrCa} spell.

{@b Major Cuts.} You get a bad cut in a place very visible to others. You have disadvantage on Charisma (Persuasion) and advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks. This can be removed with the {@spell Heal Minor Wounds|WoBrCa} spell. After 1 week the Major Cuts will naturally heal and turn into a scar, which has no adverse effects.
